TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed PagesEnableSessionState extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Used to determine session-state activation for a single Web page or an entire Web application.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This enumeration determines session-state activation for an entire Web application. This value can be used in the `pages` configuration-file section to affect all .aspx pages in the Web application for the scope of the configuration file. The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.PagesSection> type allows programmatic access to the `pages` configuration section.
## Examples The following configuration file excerpt shows how to declaratively use values of the PagesEnableSessionState enumeration to specify whether the session state is enabled.
``` <system.web> <pages enableSessionState="true" /> </system.web>
```
The following code example shows how to use the PagesEnableSessionState enumeration with the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.PagesSection> type.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.PagesSection#14](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.configurati_56_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.PagesSection#14](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.configurati_56_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Configuration.PagesEnableSessionState False = int32(0)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Configuration.PagesEnableSessionState ReadOnly = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Session state is enabled, but not writable.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Configuration.PagesEnableSessionState True = int32(2)
